metadata.title: Human-in-the-Loop Design
metadata.description: Learn to design AI systems that effectively combine artificial intelligence with human expertise, judgment, and oversight for optimal decision-making and control.
objectives: Design effective human-AI collaboration patterns and interfaces
Implement intelligent intervention points and escalation mechanisms
Build transparent AI systems with explainable decision-making
Create adaptive systems that learn from human feedback and corrections
Design approval workflows and human oversight mechanisms
Develop user-friendly interfaces for human-AI interaction

questions.question: When should human intervention be triggered in an AI system?

options.text: Only when the AI system fails completely
When confidence scores are low, edge cases are detected, or critical decisions are required
At random intervals to keep humans engaged
Never, as it defeats the purpose of automation

questions.explanation: Human intervention should be strategically triggered when the AI system has low confidence, encounters edge cases, or needs to make critical decisions that require human judgment.
